source.text: Smith, Category Theory, pp.14–15 (§§2.5–2.6: isomorphisms, reinterpreting products; product 'same table' principle)

definitions: Products determined up to isomorphism by their componentwise operation
Universal property: for any K with homs f:K→G and g:K→H, there is a unique ⟨f,g⟩:K→G×H s.t. π1∘⟨f,g⟩=f and π2∘⟨f,g⟩=g
